name: Residential College in the Arts and Humanities

RCAH111.name: Writing in Transcultural Contexts
RCAH111.description: Focused instruction in writing. Multiple forms and genres of composition. Other forms of composing such as music, painting, sculpture, and dance. Diverse texts and communities from the local to the global.
RCAH111.restrictions: Open to undergraduate students in the Residential College in the Arts and Humanities.

RCAH112.name: Writing, Research and Technologies
RCAH112.description: Arguments and analysis in oral, written, and digital formats. Methods of research, inquiry, and presentation. Research design and immersion activities. Writing for public engagement.
RCAH112.prerequisite: (RCAH 111) or Completion of Tier I Writing Requirement
RCAH112.restrictions: Open to undergraduate students in the Residential College in the Arts and Humanities.

RCAH150.name: Introduction to the Arts and Humanities
RCAH150.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
RCAH150.description: Introduction to the fundamentals of interdisciplinary studies with a focus on the humanities, arts, community engagement, and language and culture.

RCAH202.name: The Presence of the Past
RCAH202.description: Cultural significance of main currents in world history. Ethical challenges. Experiential learning activities. Dilemmas of future engagement. Career implications.
RCAH202.restrictions: Open to undergraduate students in the Residential College in the Arts and Humanities.

RCAH203.name: Transcultural Relations through the Ages
RCAH203.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
RCAH203.description: Key theoretical issues in the study of transcultural relationships. Broad historical perspective. Earliest development of societies. Interaction of early cultures. Crucial technological developments. Transcultural interactions today.
RCAH203.prerequisite: (RCAH 112 and RCAH 202) and completion of Tier I writing requirement
RCAH203.restrictions: Open to undergraduate students in the Residential College in the Arts and Humanities and not open to freshmen.

RCAH215.name: Introduction to Theory and Method in the Arts
RCAH215.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
RCAH215.description: Introduction to fundamental elements of the arts and artistic practice and their value in social life.
RCAH215.restrictions: Open to undergraduate students in the Residential College in the Arts and Humanities.

RCAH225.name: Introduction to Community Engagement
RCAH225.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
RCAH225.description: Introduction to the basic theories and methods of community engagement, its essential features, and its value as a form of social justice.
RCAH225.restrictions: Open to undergraduate students in the Residential College in the Arts and Humanities.

RCAH235.name: Introduction to Language and Culture Studies
RCAH235.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
RCAH235.description: Introduction to basic theories and methods in language and culture studies.
RCAH235.restrictions: Open to undergraduate students in the Residential College in the Arts and Humanities.

RCAH281.name: Career Strategies
RCAH281.description: Identify, explore, and prepare for career opportunities in the interdisciplinary arts and humanities. Topics include self-assessment, career strategies, internship, and job search skills.
RCAH281.restrictions: Open to undergraduate students in the Residential College in the Arts and Humanities.

RCAH304.name: Lesbian, Gay, Bisexual, Transgender, Queer (LGBTQ) and Sexuality Studies
RCAH304.description: Interdisciplinary study of the history, politics, theories, science, cultures, and communities of lesbian, gay, transgender, queer, and intersex people including a global perspective.

RCAH315.name: Methods in the Arts
RCAH315.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
RCAH315.description: Advanced engagement with the skills and methods used in the creation of visual and performing arts.
RCAH315.restrictions: Open to undergraduate students in the Residential College in the Arts and Humanities.

RCAH316.name: Topics in the Arts
RCAH316.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
RCAH316.description: Topics in the study of the visual and performing arts from an interdisciplinary perspective.
RCAH316.restrictions: Open to undergraduate students in the Residential College in the Arts and Humanities.

RCAH325.name: Methods in Community Engagement
RCAH325.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
RCAH325.description: Advanced study in the skills and methods used in community engagement work.
RCAH325.restrictions: Open to undergraduate students in the Residential College in the Arts and Humanities.

RCAH326.name: Topics in Community Engagement
RCAH326.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
RCAH326.description: Topics and themes in the study of community engagement work.
RCAH326.restrictions: Open to undergraduate students in the Residential College in the Arts and Humanities.

RCAH335.name: Methods in Language and Culture
RCAH335.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
RCAH335.description: Theories and methods in the study of language and culture from an interdisciplinary perspective.
RCAH335.restrictions: Open to undergraduate students in the Residential College in the Arts and Humanities.

RCAH336.name: Topics in Language and Culture
RCAH336.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
RCAH336.description: Topics in the study of language and culture from an interdisciplinary perspective.
RCAH336.restrictions: Open to undergraduate students in the Residential College in the Arts and Humanities.

RCAH345.name: Methods in the Humanities
RCAH345.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
RCAH345.description: Advanced engagement in theories and methods in the study of the humanities.
RCAH345.restrictions: Open to undergraduate students in the Residential College in the Arts and Humanities.

RCAH346.name: Topics in Humanities
RCAH346.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
RCAH346.description: Advanced engagement in important themes in the study of humanities.
RCAH346.restrictions: Open to undergraduate students in the Residential College in the Arts and Humanities.

RCAH391.name: Independent Study
RCAH391.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
RCAH391.description: Supervised special projects arranged by an individual student and faculty member in areas supplementing regular course offerings.
RCAH391.restrictions: Open to undergraduate students in the Residential College in the Arts and Humanities. Approval of college.

RCAH392.name: Internship
RCAH392.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
RCAH392.description: Advanced course consisting of supervised practical experience in a professional environment.
RCAH392.prerequisite: (RCAH 150) and completion of Tier I writing requirement
RCAH392.restrictions: Open to sophomores or juniors or seniors in the Residential College in the Arts and Humanities. Approval of college.

RCAH395.name: Special Topics in the Arts and Humanities
RCAH395.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
RCAH395.description: Special topics in arts and humanities to supplement regular course offerings.
RCAH395.restrictions: Open to undergraduate students in the Residential College in the Arts and Humanities.

RCAH450.name: Experiential Learning
RCAH450.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
RCAH450.description: Approved undergraduate research, creative, or community engagement project directed by a faculty member.
RCAH450.prerequisite: (RCAH 150) and completion of Tier I writing requirement
RCAH450.restrictions: Open to undergraduate students in the Residential College in the Arts and Humanities.

RCAH491.name: Senior Thesis (W)
RCAH491.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
RCAH491.description: Thesis-length independent research project under faculty supervision.
RCAH491.prerequisite: RCAH 112 and RCAH 203 and RCAH 192 and RCAH 291
RCAH491.restrictions: Open to seniors in the Residential College in the Arts and Humanities.

RCAH492.name: Senior Seminar (W)
RCAH492.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
RCAH492.description: Capstone seminar. Topics vary. May include arts practice, civic engagement, language and culture, and humanities research.
RCAH492.prerequisite: (RCAH 315 or RCAH 325 or RCAH 335 or RCAH 345) and Completion of Tier I Writing Requirement
RCAH492.restrictions: Open to seniors in the Residential College in the Arts and Humanities.
